Description:
Effective rates limits display to the latest copy of rate at each rate level
 
So given today's date is 6th october:
 
Timekeeper rates, USD currency
5th oct, rate level 1
6th oct, rate level 1
7th oct, rate level 1
 
Only 6th Oct level rate would be displayed, as future rate hasn't kicked in, and the 5th oct rate has been superceded by the 6th oct rate.
 
Each rate level + date + currency is a unique combination and will affect the search result as above (in terms of superceding previous rates or hiding future rates)

Ensure settings for "Print zero amount transactions on bill" are applied firmwide:
 
Ensure all help links open to the correct help page when clicked.
 
1. Check the zero amount transactions are not printed when the option is off.
In the admin app, turn off "Print zero amount transactions on bill."
 
In Prebill application, navigate to a Time grid.
To see the result, "Print on Bill" in the stacked grid must be turned on. (Right click on a column heading. In Stacked Grid, check "Print on Bill".)
Change the bill hour or bill amount of a transaction to 0.
Expected outcome: "Print on Bill" changes from Yes to No.
 
Check "Print Prebill", the zero transactions should not be listed.
 
2. Check the zero amount transactions are printed when the option is on.
Turn on "Print zero amount transactions on bill." option in the admin app, clear the cache, then repeat the previous test. 
Expected outcome: "Print on Bill" should remain Yes the whole time.
 
Ensure all changes that are made in the Prebill Application are reflected in the Preview Bill.

Title: CS parameters influence view of bill summary information in Prebill
Description:
In the Bill Summary (or Matter Summary), the following rows will only be displayed if the associated paramters (which are sync'd from C/S) are set to 'True':
 
To view/change in Configuration Manger:                                                            To view/change in C/S:
Path 'Business.Billing.General' name  'AllowOnAccountDisbursements'
Path 'Business.Billing.General' name  'AllowOnAccountFees'
Path 'Business.Billing.General' name  'AllowProgress'
Path 'Business.Billing.General' name  'AllowRetainer'
Path 'Business.Billing.General' name  'TimeProrateBy'
 
To check the values via SQL:
select a.*, b.id as ValueId, CONTENT,DESCRIPTION   from CFM_CONFIGURATION_NAME a 
inner join CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE b on a.ID = b.NAMEID 
where (path = 'Business.Billing.General' and name in ( 'AllowOnAccountDisbursements','AllowOnAccountFees','AllowProgress','AllowRetainer','TimeProrateBy'))
   or (path = 'Business.Billing.General.PremiumDiscounts' and name in ( 'Allow'))
   or (path = 'Business.TimeAndBilling.DebtorsAging' )
   or (path = 'Business.TimeAndBilling.General' and name in ( 'IsTBBVerified'))
   or (path = 'Business.TimeAndBilling.Time' and name in ( 'TimeInHoursMins','TimeIncrement','RoundType','IsNarrativeRequired'))
   or (PATH like  'Technical.Applications.ExpertAssistant.AvailabilityIndicator')
order by PATH
 
 
SQL to reset parameters to default values
--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'True' where ID = '876A4D58-CB12-4170-8BB9-9E4800BD82A4' --'AllowOnAccountFees'
--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'True' where ID = '03EF757A-EE63-4AED-87D2-9E4800BD8298'  --'AllowOnAccountDisbursements'
--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'True' where ID = '29361285-1FBE-44AB-8E12-9E4800BD82B9' --'AllowRetainer'

--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'True' where ID = '49712876-426D-4B88-98F6-9E4800BD8283' --'Allow'
--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'False' where ID = 'F77E3556-6D2E-4792-8398-9E4800BD7F0D' --'IsTBBVerified'
--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'True' where ID = 'CDC90E28-3F43-4A5F-ABDE-9E4800BD804C' --'IsNarrativeRequired'

--update CFM_CONFIGURATION_VALUE set CONTENT = 'False' where ID = '52528B56-47EB-49F8-9AE2-9E4800BC4856' --'EnableAvailabilityIndicator'

Title: Transfer disbursements to another matter (different client)
Area: ExpertSuite\Billing\Billing App\Paperless PreBill\Markup Workflow\Return Prebill to WIP
Description:
Ensure that you can successfully transfer a disbursement entry to another matter for a different client.
 
TEST STEPS:
1. Accept Prebill markup task. Prebill Editor tab should be displayed.
2. Select Disbursements page for one of the matters in the prebill. Disbursement Entries page should display (all disbursement types).
3. Right-click on a disbursement entry and select Transfer. Transfer dialog should be displayed with the current matter and client name in the From field.
4. Select the matter to transfer 'To' for a different client and select a 'Reason' (both fields should be required).
* Leave 'Open Time Card when done' checkbox unselected.
* Click 'OK' button.
 
EXPECTED RESULTS:
* The disbursement entry should be removed from the current disbursement page
* The current disbursement page total should be reduced by the transferred disbursement amount.
* Ensure there is a correct change log entry in the Changes pane.
* Ensure the summary pane has been updated accordingly.
* Ensure the matter summary page has been updated accordingly.
* Ensure the bill summary page has been updated accordingly.
* Complete the task and ensure the change has been persisted to the BLE_MARKUP_DETAIL table in the Expert database. The new and original values are in the MARKUP MESSAGE column.
 
select * from BLE_MARKUP_DETAIL 
where markup_type != 'TS'
order by ROW_UNO desc

Title: MultiCurrency - Time Entries for Matter - Check the figures in the Time grid
Description:
The implementation of multi-currency should affect the calculation and retrieval of the Time pages in a prebill application.
 
1. Bill Amount column does not undergo the conversion process and hence no change should be reflected (this is stored and displayed in bill currency until bill is posted).
2. Base Amount and Standard Amount undergo the conversion process and hence check if the values are correctly calculated.
